summary: This document is an electronic communication from the FBI requesting travel concurrence for agents to interview witnesses in an ongoing investigation involving Jeffrey Epstein. The investigation focuses on allegations of Epstein engaging in sexual activities with underage females and paying them for these acts. The document outlines the planned travel dates and the locations of the interviews.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is the primary subject of the investigation involving allegations of sexual activity with underage females.

persons.name: Ghislaine N. Maxwell
persons.context: Ghislaine N. Maxwell is mentioned as a subject related to the investigation involving Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: AUSA
persons.context: AUSA refers to the Assistant United States Attorneys who will accompany the Special Agents for witness interviews.

connections.description: Both are subjects of the investigation involving allegations of sexual activities with minors.
Special Agents and Assistant United States Attorneys are working together on the investigation.

events.title: Investigation Opened
events.description: The FBI opened an investigation into Jeffrey Epstein involving allegations of sexual activity with underage females.

events.title: Witness Interviews Planned
events.description: FBI agents and AUSA plan to travel to conduct witness interviews related to the Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: The investigation involves numerous underage females recruited for sexual activities with Jeffrey Epstein.
Minors were reportedly paid between $200 and $1,000 for engaging in sexual activities.
FBI Miami is coordinating with FBI New York and Newark for witness interviews.
The planned travel for interviews is set for December 14-17, 2006.
